title: Montini: Assault gun ruling no assault on gun rights
text:

Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. 1 EJ Montini , The Republic | azcentral.com Published 11:36 a.m. MT Feb. 22, 2017 | Updated 5 hours ago 43 Shares 
Assault weapon on sale at a Valley gun shop (Photo: Patrick Breen/The Republic) 
The Chicken Littles of the National Rifle Association will no doubt be taking to the airways (and soliciting your donations) because, they’ll say, “THE SKY IS FALLING!” 
It’s not. 
Does that mean that the dark helicopters and ninja-like goon squads are coming for your guns? 
No. 
Does it mean that the Second Amendment no longer applies? 
No. 
The well-armed hysterics with the NRA and their most ardent supporters will be making that claim. 
They’re wrong. 
All the ruling means is that, in Maryland, which passed the ban in 2013 after the Sandy Hook Elementary School massacre in Connecticut, there is a ban on these particular weapons. 
It was a decision made by Maryland’s legislature 
The court used as guidance a Supreme Court ruling that described such weapons as “most useful in military service.” 
They’ve also proved most useful to mass murderers. 
As such, the court said they are not covered by the Constitution. 
We’ll see if the case proceeds to the Supreme Court. 
In the meantime perhaps we’d be wise to take a breath and read what Judge J. Harvie Wilkinson, an appointee of President Ronald Reagan, in agreeing with the opinion. The sky is not falling. However, there is perhaps a glimmer of sunlight. 
Judge Wilkinson wrote, “To say in the wake of so many mass shootings in so many localities across this country that the people themselves are now to be rendered newly powerless, that all they can do is stand by and watch as federal courts design their destiny — this would deliver a body blow to democracy as we have known it since the very founding of this nation.” 
Yeah...what he said. Read or Share this story: http://azc.cc/2m8ycwZ Most Popular
